summary: The Abraham Accords are agreements that helped improve relationships between Israel and some Arab countries. In 2020, the United Arab Emirates (UAE) and Bahrain agreed to recognize Israel, making them the first Arab countries to do so in a long time. They established full diplomatic relations. The accords were named after the prophet Abraham, who is important in both Judaism and Islam. Later, Sudan and Morocco also agreed to normalize ties with Israel. These agreements were supported by the United States.
title: Abraham Accords
